newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's Lisnave says to reduce capital.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's Lisnave says to reduce capital.

text.p: Portuguese ship repairer Lisnave-Estaleiros Navais de Lisboa said on Wednesday that its planned restructuring would involve a cut in capital.
It said in a statement that a shareholder assembly would be called to approve the plan. The Lisbon bourse suspended share trade in Lisnave shortly before the announcement.

The Mello Group, Lisnave's main shareholder, and the government recently reached an accord on the restructuring which would involve splitting up the company's operations with the creation of a new ship repairing unit and another company that will seek jobs for its excess labour.
"A general shareholder assembly will be called to rule on the transformation of the company....and the reduction of its capital," Lisnave said.
"That reduction in capital...will be a sacrifice for all Lisnave shareholders," it said.
The company gave no date for the shareholder meeting.
